banner_desc.text: We are a team of experts and entrepreneurs who are dedicated to helping women achieve their reproductive choices.

richText.text: Our mission is to empower women. By providing a direct solution to today’s birth control needs, our hope is to help women take charge of their reproductive health and better plan their futures. Empowered women empower others.

bio.text: Emily has led the Venova Team as Co-Founder & CEO since inception. Emily is the recipient of a NIH SBIR/STTR Phase I grant award and two NIH/NICHD X01 service contracts. Emily has worked in several medical device industries, including orthopedic implants, advanced stenting technologies, heart valve implants, and exoskeleton devices. Her academic and industry experience span healthcare, biomechanics and mechanobiology, cancer biomarker research, cell therapy, and include contributions to the first IND clearance from the FDA for a multiplex-base edited investigational drug. Emily holds a BS and MS in Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering from Northeastern University, where she received a University Presidential Global Scholarship Award, Distinguished Scholar Award, and was inducted into the Huntington 100. In 2021, Emily received a Northeastern University Women Who Empower Award.

Kate is the Vice-Chair of Academics in the Department of OB/GYN and Associate Program Director of the Complex Family Planning Fellowship at Boston Medical Center (BMC), and an Associate Professor of OB/GYN at the Boston University Chobanian and Avedisian School of Medicine. Kate is an active clinician-scientist who has had independent research funding for the past 15 years. She is the site PI for the NICHD Contraceptive Clinical Trials Network and participates in the design and execution of trials of new contraceptive methods. Kate has been the PI on randomized clinical trials, cohort studies and cross-sectional surveys, and has overseen all aspects of these trials from protocol development and creation of instruments, to data cleaning, analysis, and dissemination of results. She frequently lectures locally and nationally on a number of topics related to reproductive health, including IUDs, emergency contraception, and new contraceptive methods. Kate is also the author of Your Sexual Health and Your Guide to Miscarriage and Pregnancy Loss, both published by Mayo Clinic Press. Kate is a board certified OB/GYN, completed her Fellowship in Complex Family Planning and received a Masters of Public Health Degree at Columbia University, and completed her residency in OB/GYN at Baystate Medical Center/Tufts University School of Medicine.
